channel.title: Projects on VP Nagraj
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on VP Nagraj

item.title: LOLAweb
item.description: LOLAweb is a web server and interactive results viewer for enrichment of overlap between a query region set (a bed file) and a database of region sets. It provides an interactive result explorer to visualize the highest ranked enrichments from the database. You can access the web server at http://lolaweb.databio.org

item.title: Workshops
item.description: I have experience teaching a variety of workshop material around basic programming and data analysis techniques. These are typically offered as hands-on sessions that are free for faculty, staff and students.

item.title: epicontacts
item.description: A collection of tools for representing epidemiological contact data, composed of case line lists and contacts between cases. Also contains procedures for data handling, interactive graphics, and statistics.

item.title: hei
item.description: Calculates Healthy Eating Index (HEI) scores for National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) data sets to facilitate analysis of demographic and dietary differences.

item.title: rrefine
item.description: ‘OpenRefine’ (formerly ‘Google Refine’) is a popular, open source data cleaning software. This package enables users to programmatically trigger data transfer between R and ‘OpenRefine’. Available functionality includes project import, export and deletion.

item.title: simpleCache
item.description: Provides intuitive functions for caching R objects, encouraging reproducible, restartable, and distributed R analysis. The user selects a location to store caches, and then provides nothing more than a cache name and instructions (R code) for how to produce the R object. Also provides some advanced options like environment assignments, recreating or reloading caches, and cluster compute bindings (using the ‘batchtools’ package) making it flexible enough for use in large-scale data analysis projects.

item.title: Courses
item.description: I have experience teaching several courses at the University of Virginia. These are similar in content to workshops but offered in a for-credit format.
